briefTitle: Second Line Induction Therapy and Healthy Diet for Patients With Ulcerative Colitis
officialTitle: A Randomized Control Study to Examine the Influence of a Healthy Diet on Moderate to Severe Ulcerative Colitis Patients Undergoing Second Line Induction With Advanced Therapies

interventions.name: A plant based high fiber diet that mimics fasting ("FMD") plus advanced therapy
Advanced therapy only without dietary intervention

summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether a diet intervention (the Fasting Mimicking diet) will help induce clinical and biochemical response to an advanced therapy in patients with ulcerative colitis. Study period will be 8 weeks during induction of advanced therapies. The primary aims of this study will be clinical response, as determined by the simple clinical colitis activity index (SCCAI). Secondary outcomes will be improvement in fecal calprotectin and C-reactive protein levels.

primaryOutcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Who Achieved Clinical Response

effectByArm.arm: Advanced Therapy Without FMD (Medication Only Group)
